articles.title: MoS Margherita lays foundation for textile exports, discusses jobs for Indians during Russia visit | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: Moscow [Russia], October 5 (ANI): India is actively exploring the possibility of increasing its textile exports to Russia, and possibly to other CIS countries, as it understandably intensifies its diversification efforts. On an official three-day visit to Russia this week, Minister of State for Textiles and External Affairs, Pabitra Margherita, underlined India's intent to deepen engagement with the Russian textile industry across trade, technology, and manpower, among others. India currently exports textiles worth USD 37.4 billion, and the government is aiming for a threefold increase by 2030.

articles.title: Elon Musk confirms Grokipedia Version 0.1 coming soon: What is it and release timeline | Mint
articles.excerpt: Tech entrepreneur Elon Musk has confirmed that the early beta of Grokipedia, a Wikipedia competitor developed by his xAI company, will be published in two weeks. The announcement was made on 5 October 2025 through Musk’s official X account, where he retweeted a post by an X user @amXFreeze, highlighting the upcoming release and the platform’s ambitious goals. According to @amXFreeze, Grokipedia is intended to be “the world’s largest and most accurate knowledge source, for humans and AI, with no limits on use.” The post also suggested that the platform would use Musk’s Grok AI chatbot to analyse sources such as Wikipedia, identify falsehoods or half-truths, and rewrite entries to provide fuller context.

articles.title: Drug watchdog wants action against Coldrif makers under serious offences: Report
articles.excerpt: The Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) will direct the Tamil Nadu Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to take strict action against the makers of Coldrif syrup under the most serious offences, following the deaths of nine children allegedly due to consumption of contaminated cough syrups, official sources told news agency ANI. The Union Health Secretary will convene a video conference with principal secretaries, health secretaries, and drug controllers from all states and Union Territories to discuss the rational use of cough syrups and drug quality, sources added. The CDSCO has launched risk-based inspections of drug manufacturing units in six states -- Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Madhya Pradesh, and Maharashtra -- after collecting 19 samples, including cough syrups, antipyretics, and antibiotics, amid deaths of 11 children in Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan..

articles.title: Govt launches probe into e-commerce platforms over extra charges classified as Dark Pattern | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: New Delhi [India], October 5 (ANI): The Department of Consumer Affairs has received several complaints against e-commerce platforms for charging extra fees under various names, a practice that the government has classified as a "dark pattern" that misleads and exploits consumers. Union Minister for Consumer Affairs, Food and Public Distribution, and New and Renewable Energy, Pralhad Joshi, shared the information on X, saying that the ministry has started a detailed investigation into the matter. articles.title: Anand Mahindra downloads Arattai ‘with pride’, Sridhar Vembu thanks support, says ‘gives us more determination’ | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: Billionaire industrialist Anand Mahindra and Zoho's Chief Scientist Sridhar Vembu's conversations on social media over up-and-coming ‘swadeshi’ messaging app Arattai, has warmed netizens' hearts. The interaction began with Mahindra & Mahindra Chairman Anand Mahindra sharing on X (formerly Twitter), that he has downloaded Arattai “with pride”, as the indigenous messaging app looks poised to give Meta's WhatsApp some competition in the Indian market. He wrote, “Downloaded Arattai today… With pride.” Sridhar Vembu responded to Anand Mahindra's post saying, “Thank you so much, this means a lot”, and then quoted it to tell the billionaire that a team member pointed out the praise, and this “gives us even more determination”..

articles.title: Left with no hope: UP man jumps into river with 4 children after wife elopes
articles.excerpt: A man and his four children allegedly jumped into the Yamuna River in Uttar Pradesh after his wife eloped with another man, police said on Saturday. According to police, the man, identified as Salman, took the extreme step following a dispute with his wife on Friday. Before taking the plunge, he recorded a video and sent it to his sister, Gulista, in which he held his wife, Khushnuma, and her lover responsible.

articles.title: 6 dead in bridge collapse in Darjeeling; heavy rain, landslides cut off roads
articles.excerpt: At least six people have died in West Bengal’s Darjeeling district after a landslide struck Mirik. The Dudia Iron Bridge, which connects the district towns and tourist hotspots of Mirik and Kurseong, has also collapsed. A landslide, triggered by heavy rain, has also been reported from Hussain Khola, which lies along National Highway 110 near Kurseong, cutting off the link between Siliguri and Darjeeling.

articles.title: Even if suffocated, won’t quit Trinamool: Kunal Ghosh rules out exit buzz
articles.excerpt: Trinamool Congress leader Kunal Ghosh, who created a flutter in political circles with a cryptic Facebook post, on Saturday pledged his loyalty to party supremo and West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee, saying he would never quit the party despite challenges. Ghosh, journalist-turned-TMC spokesperson, had hinted at an alleged internal discontent in his earlier post, saying that even if a "very strong heavyweight figure" disliked him, it did not concern him as he enjoyed a strong bond with "Didi" (Mamata Banerjee). In the post, he had also warned, "If my tail is set on fire like Hanuman’s, I will set Lanka ablaze," as "ordinary party workers must keep vigil on leaders.".

Agents fired after claiming the gun was pointed at them.

articles.title: Madhya Pradesh Doctor Arrested For Prescribing 'Toxic' Cough Syrup After Death Of 14 Children
articles.excerpt: Amid the ongoing probe into the deaths of children linked to the consumption of cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh’s Chhindwara, officials have arrested Dr Praveen Soni following the registration of an FIR against him. The case is linked to the deaths of 14 children allegedly caused by Coldrif cough syrup, which was reportedly prescribed illegally by Dr Soni. The complaint has been filed against Sresan Pharmaceuticals and Dr Soni under BNS 276, BNS 105, and Section 27A of the Drugs and Cosmetics Act for their alleged role in the tragedy..

articles.title: Health Ministry Calls Urgent Meeting Over Cough Syrup-Linked Deaths In Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan
articles.excerpt: The Ministry of Health is set to hold an urgent meeting at 4.00 pm on Sunday to address the critical issue of contaminated cough syrups following the death of multiple children in Madhya Pradesh. The meeting, which will include Principal Secretaries, Health Secretaries, and Drug Controllers from all States and Union Territories (UTs), will be chaired by the Health Secretary and will have two focus points, the rational use of cough syrups and the quality of drugs. According to the details, today’s meeting aims to reinforce control measures and ensure the safety and quality of pharmaceutical products in the country, especially over-the-counter medicines like cough syrups, which are generally not recommended for children under five years of age..

articles.title: Vedanta Demerger: Company Extends Deadline Till March 2026 As Approvals Pending; Details Here
articles.excerpt: Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Ltd has pushed the deadline for its demerger to March-end next year as the approvals from the National Company Law Tribunal and government authorities are still pending, according to a regulatory filing. The deadline was earlier extended from March 31, 2025, to September 30 this year. “Given that the conditions precedent in the Scheme, including approval of the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai Bench (NCLT) and approvals from certain government authorities are in the process of being completed, the board of the company and the resulting companies…have decided to extend the timeline for fulfilment of the conditions precedent from September 30, 2025 to March 31, 2026," Vedanta had said in a filing this week.

However, those opting to pay in cash will continue to pay double the regular toll fee. The National Highways Fee (Determination of Rates and Collection) (Third Amendment) Rules, 2025, will come into effect from November 15, 2025, the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways (MoRTH) said in a notification on Saturday.

articles.title: Forgotten Bank Deposits? How To Check And Claim Your Dormant Bank Account Money
articles.excerpt: A large amount of unclaimed money of bank customers across India is lying in the RBI’s DEA fund. If a bank’s customer account remains dormant for over 2 years, then as per RBI guidelines, banks have to transfer the unclaimed asset to RBI’s DEA fund. A lot of people think that once a bank transfers money to RBI’s DEA fund due to inoperativeness, then they won’t be allowed to take their money back.

articles.title: 7 best ways to consume chia seeds for weight loss - Chia Seed Water
articles.excerpt: Soak 1 tablespoon of chia seeds in a glass of water for 30 minutes. Drink it on an empty stomach to boost metabolism and suppress appetite naturally. Add soaked chia seeds to fruit or protein smoothies.
articles.content_snippet: Soak 1 tablespoon of chia seeds in a glass of water for 30 minutes. Drink it on an empty stomach to boost metabolism and suppress appetite naturally. Add soaked chia seeds to fruit or protein smoothies. They add thickness, fiber, and protein, keeping you full and energized longer. Mix chia seeds with milk or almond milk and refrigerate overnight. Add fruits or nuts for a creamy, low-calorie breakfast that aids weight loss.

articles.title: 7 superfoods that support healthy weight loss - Chia Seeds - The Economic Times
articles.excerpt: Packed with fiber and omega-3s, chia seeds expand in your stomach, promoting fullness. They also balance blood sugar levels, preventing sudden hunger pangs and overeating. Green tea is rich in catechins, antioxidants that speed up fat burning and improve metabolism.
articles.content_snippet: Packed with fiber and omega-3s, chia seeds expand in your stomach, promoting fullness. They also balance blood sugar levels, preventing sudden hunger pangs and overeating. Green tea is rich in catechins, antioxidants that speed up fat burning and improve metabolism. Drinking 2–3 cups daily helps the body burn calories more efficiently. Oats are a great source of soluble fiber, which slows digestion and keeps you full longer. They help manage appetite and support healthy cholesterol levels.

articles.title: 7 foods that lower blood pressure naturally - Leafy Greens - The Economic Times
articles.excerpt: Spinach, kale, and Swiss chard are rich in potassium, which helps your kidneys flush out excess sodium — a major factor in high blood pressure. Blueberries, strawberries, and raspberries are loaded with antioxidants called anthocyanins that improve blood vessel function and reduce blood pressure levels over time. Oats contain beta-glucan, a soluble fiber that supports heart health by improving cholesterol levels and relaxing blood vessels to lower blood pressure..

articles.title: Axis Securities names Bank of Baroda among top 3 technical picks with upside potential up to 18% - Weekly market recap and outlook
articles.excerpt: The Indian equity benchmarks ended the week on a strong note, with the Nifty 50 closing at 24,894—up 240 points—after a late recovery fueled by the RBI’s policy decision, softening crude oil prices, and renewed optimism across sectors. While the Nifty started the week on a positive note, it briefly extended the previous week’s selling pressure before staging a strong rebound post the central bank’s announcement.Bank Nifty displayed firm strength throughout the week, starting with an upward gap and maintaining positive momentum to close at 55,589, marking a 1,200-point gain. For the coming week, the Nifty is expected to trade within the 25,500–24,300 range with a mixed bias, while the Bank Nifty is likely to move in the 56,500–54,000 zone with a positive bias.With this, let’s look at the top technical picks recommended by Axis Securities for a holding period of 3–4 weeks with up to 18% upside potential: Poonawalla Fincorp has witnessed a decisive breakout above multiple resistance zones near Rs 515 on the weekly chart, confirming the continuation of a medium-term uptrend.

articles.title: Richard Desmond legal action over National Lottery award to begin at high court
articles.excerpt: Billionaire suing Gambling Commission for up to £1.3bn over licence award, with payout potentially funded by the taxpayer The media billionaire Richard Desmond will begin a bitter courtroom battle with the Gambling Commission this week that could cost taxpayers hundreds of millions of pounds in a row over the licence to run the National Lottery. Northern & Shell and The New Lottery Company (TNLC), owned by Desmond, are suing the gambling regulator for up to £1.3bn, alleging “manifest errors” in the labyrinthine competition process for Britain’s largest public sector contract, the lottery licence. Allwyn, a new vehicle ultimately owned by the Czech billionaire Karel Komárek, won the 10-year licence in 2022 and has run the draw since 2024, the first time in the lottery’s 30-year history that it had been run by a company other than Camelot.

The decision comes as advocates claimed that several transfers to adult detention were scheduled for the current weekend. The order affects children who entered the country alone and without legal permission, preventing their automatic placement in adult detention when they reach adulthood.

articles.title: Prabowo Tells Army to Guard Raw Resources From Foreign Groups

articles.title: Stellantis Said to Plan $10 Billion in US Turnaround Investments | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: Stellantis NV is planning to invest about $10 billion in the US as the troubled maker of Jeep sport utility vehicles and Ram pickups refocuses on the market that’s pivotal to its profits, according to people familiar with the situation. The carmaker may announce in the coming weeks about $5 billion in fresh money on top of a similar amount earmarked earlier in the year, said the people, who declined to be identified discussing information that’s not public. The investments over several years could be funneled into plants — including re-openings, hiring and new models — in states such as Illinois and Michigan, the people said.

articles.title: Multi-crore Ponzi scam uncovered in Thane, 4 arrested
articles.excerpt: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Thane City Police has uncovered a multi-crore Ponzi and investment fraud that duped thousands of investors, primarily working-class individuals, out of their hard-earned money. The scam, run by Phoenix Investments in Dombivli for the past three to four years, promised high returns and initially paid out investors until early 2024. However, since then, the masterminds and their accomplices allegedly fled the city with crores of rupees, leaving offices and branches shuttered and investors in despair.

articles.excerpt: As Delhi Police continue their probe into the molestation and sexual harassment allegations against self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyanand Saraswati, disturbing details have now emerged about his social media behaviour. Posts from his verified X (formerly Twitter) account reveal a pattern of inappropriate, flirtatious, and suggestive comments on photographs uploaded by women. In one instance, a woman posted a picture captioned, “I’m from Islamabad and you?” to which Chaitanyanand replied, “I am from NYC.” In another, a user wrote in Hindi, “Khana bana rahi hu aap sab ke liye, kaun kaun khaega?” (I’m cooking for everyone, who wants to eat?).

articles.title: Vedanta extends deadline for demerger to March next year | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Oct 4 (PTI) Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Ltd has pushed the deadline for its demerger to March-end next year as the approvals from the National Company Law Tribunal and government authorities are still pending, the company has said in a regulatory filing. The deadline was earlier extended from March 31, 2025 to September 30 this year. "Given that the conditions precedent in the Scheme, including approval of the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai Bench (NCLT) and approvals from certain government authorities are in the process of being completed, the board of the company and the resulting companies...have decided to extend the timeline for fulfilment of the conditions precedent from September 30, 2025 to March 31, 2026," Vedanta had said in a filing this week..

articles.title: Snapchat to soon start charging for storage — Check step-by-step guide to save memories for free, paid plans | Mint
articles.excerpt: GenZ's one of the favourite apps Snapchat has announced that users would soon have to pay for memories storage after a decade of offering unlimited access to manage and back up their content such as images and videos. However, users can still save content for free within a 5GB limit. If the Memories exceed the limit, then the individual would have to either export them or sign up for one of Snapchat’s new Memories Storage plans in order to preserve them.

articles.title: Populist Andrej Babis's party ahead in Czech polls, may fall short of majority
articles.excerpt: Czech billionaire and former Prime Minister Andrej Babis's populist ANO party had a wide lead in a parliamentary election on Saturday, after nearly 50 per cent of voting districts had reported, statistics office data showed. ANO had 38.3 per cent of votes, ahead of Prime Minister Petr Fiala's centre-right Spolu group with 20.3 per cent. Six parties were above the 5 per cent threshold to win seats in the 200-member lower house, according to the partial results.

The AAP agitation came days after the state Medical and Health Department halted the supply of all 19 medicines manufactured by Kaysons Pharma, along with all other syrups containing dextromethorphan, until further orders. articles.title: Hold Bihar election soon after Chhath, in single phase: Parties urge poll body
articles.excerpt: Political parties in Bihar on Saturday urged the Election Commission of India (ECI) to schedule the state Assembly elections immediately after the Chhath festival, which falls on October 28 this year. Parties also recommended that the elections be conducted in the minimum possible phases to ensure smoother voting and counting.ECI MEETING WITH POLITICAL PARTIES The Commission interacted with representatives of recognised national and state parties, including the Aam Aadmi Party, Bahujan Samaj Party, Bharatiya Janata Party, Communist Party of India (Marxist), Indian National Congress, National People's Party, CPI(ML) Liberation, Janata Dal (United), Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas), Rashtriya Janata Dal, and Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party. During the discussions, parties emphasised holding elections immediately after Chhath and completing the process in as few phases as possible.HOLD ASSEMBLY ELECTIONS IN A SINGLE PHASE: JD(U).

articles.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Rs 19,647 crore Navi Mumbai airport on October 8
articles.excerpt: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first phase of the Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) on October 8, a senior Maharashtra government official confirmed on Saturday. The state-of-the-art greenfield airport has been built at a cost of Rs 19,647 crore and will mark the second major airport in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region after the existing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport. The commercial flight operations from Navi Mumbai Airport are expected to begin in December.

articles.title: UK PM Keir Starmer to make first official visit to India next week
articles.excerpt: The United Kingdom’s Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, will make his first official visit to India on October 8-9, 2025, at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced.INDIA-UK STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP IN FOCUS During the two-day visit, the two leaders are expected to review progress under the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership through the ‘Vision 2035’ roadmap, a 10-year plan covering trade and investment, technology and innovation, defence and security, climate and energy, health, education, and people-to-people ties. On October 9 in Mumbai, Modi and Starmer will engage with business and industry leaders to explore opportunities presented by the India–UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). The discussions will also cover issues of regional and global importance.

articles.title: 2 killed in suspected methane explosion at UP coaching centre
articles.excerpt: At least two people were killed and seven others injured in an explosion at a coaching centre in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad on Saturday. The blast likely occurred due to excessive concentrated methane in the septic tank located in the coaching centre's basement, police said. Methane is a highly flammable gas and its accumulation in confined spaces such as septic tanks can pose a significant risk if not properly ventilated.

The IT services sector is expected to remain sluggish in Q2 FY26, as demand continues to be muted amid macroeconomic uncertainties and the deflationary effects of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Layoff News: Carmaker Renault plans to cut 3,000 jobs through voluntary redundancy offer, says report | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: French carmaker Renault is reportedly planning to lay off 3,000 employees worldwide, primarily in support roles through a voluntary redundancy program — an offer where staff can choose to leave the company in exchange for a financial package, instead of being directly laid off. The final decision on the lay off is expected to be made by the end of the year, reported French newsletter L'Informe. The job cuts are part of an internal cost savings initiative dubbed “Arrow,” under which Renault aims to reduce its workforce in support services such as human resources, finance and marketing by 15 per cent..

articles.title: Pak asks Trump to develop port on Arabian Sea, close to India's Chabahar
articles.excerpt: Pakistan has dangled an offer before US President Donald Trump to build and run a port on the Arabian Sea as it seeks to warm up to America amid a reset in ties, according to a report in the Financial Times. The civilian port will be located in Pasni, a town in Balochistan's Gwadar district, placing it strategically close to the Chabahar port being developed by India in Iran. The report said advisers to Pakistani army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir have approached top US officials with the offer, valued at up to $1.2 billion.DEEP-WATER PORT IN PASNI As per the blueprint, the US would build and operate a terminal at the port to access Pakistan's critical minerals in Pasni.

articles.excerpt: Nifty Next 50 lot size has remained unchanged. The new lot sizes will come into effect from October 28, 2025 (EOD). The existing lot size will be applicable for weekly and monthly contracts till December 30, 2025 expiry date.
articles.content_snippet: Nifty Next 50 lot size has remained unchanged. The new lot sizes will come into effect from October 28, 2025 (EOD). The existing lot size will be applicable for weekly and monthly contracts till December 30, 2025 expiry date. Lot size of existing quarterly and half yearly contracts will be revised on 30-Dec2025 EOD. Swipe Left For Next Video

articles.title: Uttar Pradesh Man Jumps Into Yamuna With Four Children After Wife Elopes
articles.excerpt: A man along with his four children allegedly jumped into the Yamuna River in Firozabad district after his wife eloped with another man, police said. According to police, the man, identified as Salman, took the extreme step following a domestic dispute with his wife on Friday. Before jumping, he recorded a video and sent it to his sister Gulista blaming his wife Khushnuma and her lover for his actions.

articles.title: Ice Cream Vendor Tries To Rape 6-Year-Old Girl In Shimla: Police
articles.excerpt: A 45-year-old ice cream vendor was arrested in the Jhakri area of Shimla district on Saturday for the alleged attempted rape of a six-year-old girl, police said. The arrest follows a complaint filed by the girl’s mother, who alleged that the man, a native of Rajasthan, lured her daughter away from her shop on the pretext of giving her ice cream. According to the mother’s account to the police, she initially did not notice her daughter’s absence as she was attending to customers.

articles.title: Maharashtra Man Drowns 4-Month-Old Son In Drum, Then Dies By Suicide
articles.excerpt: A four-month-old boy found dead in a half-filled water drum in Maharashtra’s Beed district was allegedly drowned by his father, who later killed himself, police said. The incident occurred in Talwada village of Georai taluka on Friday. According to police, the man, identified as Amol Sonavane, threw his infant son into a drum half-filled with water before ending his own life.

articles.title: Watch: Kailash Mansarovar Yatra | The Sacred journey resumes
articles.excerpt: At 6,638 meters, Kailash towers near the borders of China, India, and Nepal. At its base lie the sacred lakes, Manasarovar, symbol of purity, and Rakshastal, its darker twin. The pilgrimage, known as the Kailash Yatra, dates back countless generations.
articles.content_snippet: At 6,638 meters, Kailash towers near the borders of China, India, and Nepal. At its base lie the sacred lakes, Manasarovar, symbol of purity, and Rakshastal, its darker twin. The pilgrimage, known as the Kailash Yatra, dates back countless generations. articles.title: Hyderabad student, working at US gas station, shot dead
articles.excerpt: An Indian student from Hyderabad, who went to the US for his higher studies, was shot dead by miscreants in Texas, former Telangana minister and BRS MLA T Harish Rao said on Saturday. The victim, Chandrashekar Pole, was reportedly working part-time at a gas station in Denton, Texas, when the incident occurred. The victim had completed his Bachelor's in Dental Surgery (BDS) before moving to Dallas for further studies, said Harish Rao, the nephew of BRS chief K Chandrasekhar Rao.

articles.title: Kerala Joins Other States In Banning Coldrif Cough Syrup After Unexplained Child Deaths
articles.excerpt: After reports from Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan linked the cough syrup Coldrif to the deaths of at least 11 children over the past month, Kerala has become the latest state to suspend the sale and distribution of the medicine. Kerala’s Health Minister Veena George announced on Saturday that the state’s Drugs Control Department had ordered an immediate halt to all sales of the product as a precautionary measure. The action follows an ongoing probe into suspected contamination in a batch of the syrup, produced by Sresan Pharma, a manufacturer based in Tamil Nadu’s Kanchipuram district.

articles.title: 22-Year-Old Merchant Navy Cadet Missing From Ship Off Sri Lankan Coast, Family Seeks Help
articles.excerpt: A 22-year-old merchant navy cadet from Dehradun, Karandeep Singh Rana, has gone missing while on duty aboard an oil tanker sailing off the coast of Sri Lanka, his family said on Saturday. According to his father, Narendra Singh Rana, Karandeep disappeared on September 20 when the vessel was sailing from Iraq to China via Sri Lanka. The family is now appealing to Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami and the central government for urgent intervention in locating him.

articles.title: Road collapsed, hospital submerged as Bihar reels under floods after heavy rain
articles.excerpt: Continuous heavy rainfall over the past 24 hours has wreaked havoc across several districts of Bihar, leading to flooding, road collapses, and massive waterlogging. The worst-hit areas include Rohtas, Sasaram, Motihari, and Gopalganj, where the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) and National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) have been deployed for rescue operations. In Rohtas district’s Dehri area, the situation turned critical after incessant rain caused severe flooding in Jamuhar.

articles.title: Pak blinks as it signs deal with POK protesters, calls it victory of peace
articles.excerpt: The Pakistani government on Saturday wilted under pressure as it signed an agreement with protesters to end the demonstrations in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (POK) that raged for five days and left 12 people dead and hundreds injured. Even though the Shehbaz Sharif-led government succumbed to pressure, it called the deal "a victory for peace", a face-saving gesture. The territory witnessed one of its biggest protests in recent years, when talks collapsed between officials and leaders of the Jammu Kashmir Joint Awami Action Committee (JKJAAC), a representative body of protesters, on September 29.

articles.title: 2-Wheeler Sales Rise 9 Per Cent In September On GST Cut, Festive Demand
articles.excerpt: The domestic two-wheeler sales rose 6% YoY and 18% month-on-month (MoM), supported by strong performances from Royal Enfield (43% YoY), Suzuki Motorcycle (37% YoY), and TVS Motor (12% YoY). Trending Photos New Delhi: India’s two-wheeler manufacturers registered a 9 per cent year-on-year (YoY) increase in September dispatches, crossing the two-million mark, buoyed by festive season demand following a cut in Goods and Services Tax (GST). The government reduced the tax on motorcycles up to 350 cc to 18 per cent.

articles.title: Pakistan Proposes US-Built Pasni Port: What It Means For India And China
articles.excerpt: Trending Photos In what could mark a significant geopolitical shift in the region, advisers to Pakistan’s Army Chief General Asim Munir have reportedly presented a proposal to US officials for the construction and operation of a new port at Pasni on the Arabian Sea. The plan, if realized, would offer Washington a strategic foothold in a critical maritime corridor, just miles from Iran and China’s Gwadar port. According to a report by the Financial Times, the proposal envisions transforming the small fishing town of Pasni, located roughly 100 miles from Iran and 70 miles from Gwadar, into a hub for processing and exporting Pakistan’s critical minerals, such as copper and antimony.

articles.title: Woman Journalist Assaulted At Kolkata Railway Station, Chases Molesters Before They Flee
articles.excerpt: A 23-year-old woman journalist was assaulted late Thursday night inside the subway of Sodepur railway station after she resisted molestation by a group of youths, police said. The incident took place around 9.40 pm when the woman, a resident of Sodepur, was returning home alone after meeting a friend. According to her statement, six to seven men, allegedly drunk, followed her into the subway, passed obscene remarks and molested her.

articles.title: New York’s Roosevelt Hotel May Make Way for New Skyscraper | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Pakistan is considering options for the Roosevelt Hotel in Midtown Manhattan as part of the South Asian nation’s efforts to meet its commitments to the International Monetary Fund. One of the options is to raze the storied landmark and build a skyscraper in its place, said Muhammad Ali, adviser to the prime minister on privatization. The government is keen on a joint venture where Pakistan will contribute the land and the partner will bring in the equity, he told Bloomberg in Islamabad.

articles.title: Costco to sell weight-loss drugs such as Ozempic and Wegovy at half-price
articles.excerpt: The move comes as GLP-1 drug prices have soared as supply continues to be increasingly limited Costco has struck an agreement with drugmaker Novo Nordisk to make anti-obesity GLP-1 medications such as Ozempic and Wegovy available to its members at roughly half the usual cost. Through the store’s prescription program, members with a valid prescription can buy a four-week supply of the injectables for $499. The offer is available only to those paying out of pocket, since many insurers still do not cover these medications.

articles.title: Perplexity’s $200 Comet Browser Now Free, CEO Aravind Srinivas Takes Dig At Chrome
articles.excerpt: Perplexity AI has made its Comet browser freely available to all users, eliminating the previous $200-per-month (around Rs 17,000) paywall that restricted access to its advanced features. The announcement was made by CEO Aravind Srinivas on X (formerly Twitter) on October 2, where he also took a playful dig at Google Chrome. Resharing a post from one X user, he wrote, “O hey hi @googlechrome." Check the post here: o hey hi @googlechrome https://t.co/rpkg6JCxMJ— Aravind Srinivas (@AravSrinivas) October 2, 2025 Until now, Comet was available exclusively to Pro and Max subscribers, meaning free users were unable to access its AI-powered tools and some of its most advanced features.

articles.title: Is Zerodha Set To End Free Equity Delivery? Nikhil Kamath Flags Revenue Pressure
articles.excerpt: Zerodha co-founder Nithin Kamath in his latest blog has hinted that the online brokerage platform may implement brokerage charges for equity delivery trades from customers, which are currently non-chargeable, to ensure the sustainability of the business. “We would be forced to start charging brokerage for equity delivery trades to make the business tenable," Kamath said in the blog upon the regulator’s evaluation on whether to stop weekly options completely. Zerodha will see another revenue hit if the regulator stops weekly options completely.
